description: Old French soler, solier, from Latin solarium (“a terrace or flat roof”), from sol (“sun”).

entries.meaning: (mining) A platform in a shaft, especially one of those between the series of ladders in a shaft.

verbs.description: sollar (third-person singular simple present sollars, present participle sollaring, simple past and past participle sollared)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cover, or provide with, a sollar.
